clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Using Tranexamic Acid to Reduce Blood Loss In Simultaneous Bilateral Total Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Using Tranexamic Acid to Reduce Blood Loss In Simultaneous Bilateral Total Knee Arthroplasty: a Randomized, Double-blind, Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized, double-blind, single-center and controlled study comparing the efficacy and safety of intravenous administration of tranexamic acid to reduce blood loss in simultaneous bilateral total knee arthroplasty.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized, double-blind, single-center and controlled study comparing the efficacy and safety of intravenous administration of tranexamic acid to reduce blood loss in simultaneous bilateral total knee arthroplasty. Subjects will be monitored for occurrence of any complications, particularly deep venous thrombosis and thromboembolism during the hospital stay and for 1 months postoperatively.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Allogeneic Blood Transfusion as a Measure of Efficacy

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of Total Blood Loss as a Measure of Efficacy
Rate of Thrombotic Complications as a Measure of Safety
